postsData.name:
Anthony Vicino
Anthony Vicino
postsData.content:
Here's 7 life-changing quotes about doing hard things...

(read this if you ever struggle with procrastination)

1. Never Ready

When it comes to doing hard things, you will likely never feel ready.

The key word in that sentence is "feel".

But remember:

The universe doesn't care how you feel.
It only cares what you do.

Amateurs wait until they feel ready.
Professionals just get up and go to work.

2. Do It Anyways

I hate writing, but love having written.
I hate working out, but love having worked out.
I hate eating healthy, but love having eaten healthy.

You don't have to love the process...
Do it anyways.

3. The Work Instils the Worth

Difficulty is not always correlated with quality...
But it is almost always correlated with satisfaction.

Do hard things.

4. The Only Lessons Worth Learning

In my experience, the only lessons in life worth learning are the result of "doing hard things".

5. Discipline is a Muscle

To strengthen it, you must regularly stress it.

The trick:

Do hard things daily.

Take a cold shower...
Go for a run...
Have a hard coversation with a friend...

Doesn't matter what it is, just do it.

By doing hard things, your capacity to do MORE hard things increases.

Becoming the type of person who regularly does hard things is the best training for surviving in a universe that really doesn't have your best interest in mind.

6. Choose Hard

"Easy choices, hard life. Hard choices, easy life."
- Jerzy Gregorek

7. Never Regret

You'll never regret time spent doing hard, meaning-filled work.

Doing hard things is a great way to optimize for a life lived with no regrets.

What would you add?

***

ï¸ Repost to spread the love!

comments.commentText: The best lessons come wrapped in discomfort.

These quotes offer great wisdom. Doing hard things often leads to growth and fulfillment beyond our comfort zones. Embracing the challenge makes us more resilient over time.

ALTERED IMAGES - Google drops pledge not to use artificial intelligence for weapons or surveillance â€” WaPo

The company has rewritten the principles that guide its development and use of AI â€“ which are published online â€“ but a section pledging not to develop tech â€œthat cause or are likely to cause harmâ€ has now been removed!

Google says â€œglobal competitionâ€ for AI leadership was taking place within an â€œincreasingly complex geopolitical landscapeâ€.

â€œWe believe democracies should lead in AI development, guided by core values like freedom, equality, and respect for human rights,â€ they said.

CONTEXT: In the past, Googleâ€™s contracts to provide technology, such as cloud services, to the US and Israeli military have sparked internal protests from employees.

Maury Rogow, CEO
Maury Rogow, CEO
postsData.content:
10 Things people learn too late in Life.

Most people waste years chasing the wrong things...

Itâ€™s not their fault, they just donâ€™t know what really matters until itâ€™s too late.

1ï¸âƒ£The less you say the more your words will matter.

2ï¸âƒ£Don't take things personally:
Not everyone thinks about you as much as you do.

3ï¸âƒ£When you focus on problems:
You'll have more problems when you focus on possibilities you'll have more opportunities.

4ï¸âƒ£No matter how much it hurts now:
Someday you will look back and realize your struggle changed your life for the better.

5ï¸âƒ£You meet people for a reason:
Either you need them to change your life or you're the one that will change theirs.

6ï¸âƒ£Never be afraid to try something new:
Life gets boring when you stay within the limits of what you already know.

7ï¸âƒ£You will never truly know the value of a moment:
Until it becomes a memory.

8ï¸âƒ£Once you begin to take note of the things you are grateful for:
You begin to lose sight of the things that you lack.

9ï¸âƒ£If you do not have control over your mouth:
You do not have control over your future.

Life is a mirror and will reflect back to the Thinker what he thinks.

Have you learned any of these the hard way?

Or maybe thereâ€™s another lesson life taught you unexpectedly.

Share it in the comments

postsData.content:
The easiest way for a boss to hide their incompetence? Blame you.

When you succeed -
It is because of their great management skills.

When you struggle -
it's because you are not good enough.

Most donâ€™t even realise their own lack of skill is the real problem.

They never ask, â€œDid I fail as a leader?â€
They assume â€œYou just werenâ€™t good enough.â€

And they slap a label on you: lazy, slow, disorganised, incompetent.

Sound familiar? Hereâ€™s how to know if your boss is setting you up to fail:

1ï¸âƒ£ No Clear Expectations:
Your role feels like a moving target.

2ï¸âƒ£ Lack of Resources:
Youâ€™re expected to win with no resources.

3ï¸âƒ£ Constant Micromanagement:
Every move and decision is second-guessed.

4ï¸âƒ£ Excessive Criticism:
Mistakes are magnified. Wins are ignored.

5ï¸âƒ£ Isolation:
Youâ€™re left out of key meetings and conversations.

6ï¸âƒ£ Changing the Rules:
The goalpost keeps moving.

7ï¸âƒ£ Your Confidence is Crushed:
You start doubting yourself.

Checked off 3 or more? Itâ€™s not just you.

Swipe through the carousel for exact steps to take back control.

 Know someone dealing with this? Tag them below.
 Repost to help others spot the signs and follow me,for career advice that actually helps.

postsData.name:
Favour Commander
Favour Commander
postsData.content:
Many founders fear delegation will lead to errors. 

"I am scared to delegate - what if something goes wrong?"

They worry that handing over responsibilities would lead to mistakes and impact their business.

I remember working with a client who was hesitant to delegate tasks initially.

During the onboarding session, I paid keen attention to the instructions, familiarized myself with the tools and procedures.

I also clarified doubts within the first 2-3 days.

By the end of the first month, my client was thrilled, and that marked a significant change in our working relationship.

If you're struggling to delegate, here's what worked for us:

ï¸ Start with small tasks to build trust.

ï¸ Establish open and transparent communication.

ï¸ Set clear expectations.

Have you ever struggled with trusting someone with a task?

postsData.name:
Gordon Tredgold Globally Ranked Leadership Expert
Gordon Tredgold Globally Ranked Leadership Expert
postsData.content:
The Number One Cause of Failure.

Success starts with clarity. Without it, your chances of achieving your goals are virtually zero.

Clarity is the foundation of everything in leadership and teamwork. It means having a crystal-clear understanding of your goals, your roles, and your plan of action. Yet, so many projects, strategies, and initiatives falter because people are left guessing. Guessing what success looks like. Guessing whoâ€™s responsible for what. Guessing the next step.

When thereâ€™s no clarity:
 Effort is wasted on the wrong priorities.
 Miscommunication leads to conflict and frustration.
 Teams lose motivation because they canâ€™t see a clear path forward.

On the other hand, when clarity is present:
 Teams align and work with purpose.
 Productivity soars as people know exactly whatâ€™s expected.
 Confidence builds because everyone understands how success will be achieved.

Clarity doesnâ€™t just improve your odds of successâ€”it guarantees youâ€™ll avoid failure caused by confusion and misalignment. Every great achievement starts with the leader painting a vivid picture of what success looks like.

Remember, confusion kills execution. Success starts with clarity. Always.

Repost this to help your network & follow me Gordon Tredgold for more content like this.

comments.commentText: This resonates so much with our team's recent experiences.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Clarity is the cornerstone of success. It truly empowers teams and drives effective execution. Well said, Gordon!

postsData.name:
Audra Carpenter
Audra Carpenter
postsData.content:
Everyone's rushing to master AI overnight 

But here's the challenging truth about AI success:

It's not about speed. It's about consistency.

Yes, I know, I know. You've heard that every single day of your business life. But it's even more true here.


Listen, the winners in 2025 won't be those who:

â†³ Chased every new AI tool

â†³ Copied trending prompts

â†³ Jumped on every AI bandwagon



They'll be the ones who:

â†’ Picked ONE area of focus

â†’ Built systems + processes

â†’ Actually did the work

â†’ Stayed consistent for 12+ months



While others chase shiny objects, focus on mastery.


Because AI is both:

â†’ Moving at light speed â†’ A long-term game


The paradox?


You need to start NOW. But you also need patience.

Stop looking for overnight success. Start building your AI expertise brick by brick.


Remember AI isn't the tool to become lazier, it's a tool to help you become greater!


- Audra ï¸


ï¸ Repost this if you're playing the long game with AI.

PS: What's your ONE AI focus area for 2025? Comment below
